title: Mercer 3
text:
Mercer 3, also known as GLIMPSE-C02, is a heavily obscured <a href="globular%20cluster">globular cluster</a> embedded in the disk of the <a href="Milky%20Way">Milky Way</a> galaxy. It was discovered in 2008 in the data obtained by <a href="2MASS">2MASS</a> and <a href="Spitzer%20Space%20Telescope">GLIMPSE</a> <a href="infrared">infrared</a> surveys, and independently characterized by two groups. The cluster is located in the <a href="Scutum%20%28constellation%29">Scutum</a> constellation. It had avoided detection for such a long time due to the extremely strong foreground <a href="extinction%20%28astronomy%29">extinction</a> in its direction reaching 24 magnitudes in the visible light. Mercer 3 is probably situated at the distance from 4 to 8 <a href="Parsec%23Parsecs%20and%20kiloparsecs">kpc</a> from the Sun and has a half-light radius of 0.7–1.5 pc.
Mercer 3 is an old globular cluster having the age of about 12 billion years. The mass of cluster is estimated at 2–3 hundred thousand <a href="solar%20mass">solar mass</a>es. It is among the most <a href="metallicity">metal</a>-rich galactic globular clusters known.
